sanskrit_verse:
एतद्विधानमातिष्ठेदरोगः पृथिवीपतिः ।
अस्वस्थः सर्वमेतत्तु भृत्येषु विनियोजयेत् ॥ ७.२२६॥
transliteration:
etad vidhānam ātiṣṭhed arogaḥ pṛthivīpatiḥ |
asvasthaḥ sarvam etat tu bhṛtyeṣu viniyojayet || 7.226 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: The ruler of the land, being free from disease, shall personally establish this system of governance; but when unwell, he shall delegate all such duties to his appointed servants.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from the sovereign's embodied fitness to rule
Delegation is a lawful transfer of function, not abdication of duty
Governance capacity is conditional upon physical and mental integrity
Responsibility remains with the sovereign even when functions are delegated
Restoration of capacity justifies resumption of direct authority
executable_legal_axioms: IF sovereign_health_status = 'restored' AND verified THEN governance_functions → resumed_by_sovereign
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes that constitutional leadership retains ultimate accountability even during periods of incapacity. The delegation mechanism ensures continuity without abdicating foundational sovereignty. Courts must recognize health-based delegation as lawful while preserving the inherent jurisdiction of the original authority once capacity is restored.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: This provision aligns with Nyaya through pramāṇa-based causality: the causal link between bodily/mental fitness and executive capacity determines functional allocation. It reflects anupūrvaśaḥ in showing sequential manifestation — first illness arises, then delegation occurs, followed by potential restoration. Responsibility remains proportional to actual capacity at any given moment, affirming non-punitive reality where incapacitation triggers adjustment rather than penalty.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Conduct regular sovereign capacity assessments via qualified Vaidya panels
Establish transparent delegation protocols ensuring continuity of dharma-governance
Implement automatic review cycles for reassessment of sovereign health status
Reintegrate sovereign fully back into active governance upon verified restoration
Maintain institutional memory within servant-delegates to ensure seamless transition back
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority. This law restores Dharma through capacity-conscious governance structures, affirms reality as non-punitive, and upholds Consciousness as the Supreme Adjudicator.
